sentences.english: Xing Zhang's female employee wears a woebegone expression earth to complain to the reporter.
sentences.chinese: 一位姓張的女員工愁眉苦臉地向記者抱怨。

sentences.english: The cold, pale sunlight fell on their gloomy faces, long hair and lusterless eyes.
sentences.chinese: 冷淡的陽關照著他們的愁眉苦臉和長髮白眼。

sentences.english: It's no use pulling a long face, no one can help the fact that it is raining.
sentences.chinese: 愁眉苦臉是沒有用的，天要下雨時誰也沒法子。

sentences.english: Joe sat poking up the sand with a stick and looking very gloomy.
sentences.chinese: 喬坐在那裏用小樹枝撥弄沙子，一副愁眉苦臉相。

sentences.english: Rabby sat frowning at the intimidating pile of dirty dishes.
sentences.chinese: 拉比坐在那兒，愁眉苦臉地看着那嚇人的一堆髒碗碟。

sentences.english: George stared morosely at the water.
sentences.chinese: 喬治愁眉苦臉地愣望着河水。

sentences.english: His forehead knitted into a perplexed frown.
sentences.chinese: 他的額頭皺成一愁眉苦臉。

sentences.english: Now, don't be jerking your chin at me.
sentences.chinese: 現在，請不要在我面前愁眉苦臉了。

sentences.english: Duck feather chicken feather duck call to frown.
sentences.chinese: 鴨毛雞愁眉苦臉地給雞毛鴨打電話。

sentences.english: It immediately places a scowling expression on your face.
sentences.chinese: 你的臉上馬上會出現愁眉苦臉的表情。

sentences.english: He did not complain. not even a sour face.
sentences.chinese: 他沒抱怨，也沒愁眉苦臉。

sentences.english: Frowns, scowls and grimaces all push people away -- but a smile draws them in.
sentences.chinese: 愁眉苦臉只會把人推開，而微笑卻把人吸引過來。

sentences.english: I just walked in to find you here with that sad look upon your face.
sentences.chinese: 我一進門就看到你那張愁眉苦臉的臭面孔。

sentences.english: Frowns, scowls and grimaces all push people away -- but a smile draws them in. 1.
sentences.chinese: 愁眉苦臉只會把人推開，而微笑卻把人吸引過來。

sentences.english: Why do you look so worried?
sentences.chinese: 你爲合看起來這麼愁眉苦臉的？

sentences.english: Every time I see him, he looks miserable.
sentences.chinese: 每次我看見他，他都是一副愁眉苦臉的樣子。

definition: to shout and scream (idiom); to kick up a fuss/to make a scene
you can net sparrows at the door (idiom); completely deserted
to push oneself forward/to seek fame/to be in the limelight/same as 出鋒頭|出锋头[chu1 feng1 tou5]
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
dispirited and downcast (idiom); listless/in low spirits/washed out
every hope turns to dust (idiom); completely disheartened
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
happy to partake but not prepared to do any work (idiom)/all take and no give
